text: Correlation with an increased kappa B binding activity .

Human peripheral blood monocytes responded to stimulation of platelet - activating factor ( PAF ) with up-regulation of the transcript for <extra_id_0> heparin-binding epidermal growth factor-like growth factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> HB-EGF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , a potent mitogen for vascular smooth muscle cells .

text: This function of PAF was observed at nanomolar concentrations of the ligand , starting at 30 min after stimulation .
The PAF - induced up-regulation of <extra_id_0> HB-EGF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA was accompanied by an increase in kappa B binding activity .

These functions of PAF appeared to be mediated through the cell surface PAF receptors , as two PAF receptor antagonists , WEB 2086 and L-659 , 989 , blocked both the up-regulation of <extra_id_0> HB-EGF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA and kappa B binding activity induced by PAF .

text: The antagonists , however , had no effect on phorbol ester - induced up-regulation of <extra_id_0> HB-EGF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA and kappa B binding activity .

text: Pretreatment of monocytes with pertussis toxin inhibited these functions of PAF , whereas cholera toxin had no inhibitory effect .

Pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate , an inhibitor for NF-kappa B activation , markedly reduced PAF - stimulated kappa B binding activity as well as up-regulation of <extra_id_0> HB-EGF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA .

text: These results suggest a potential role of PAF in <extra_id_0> HB-EGF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression and provide evidence that this stimulation may occur through increased kappa B binding activity .
